alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL DE BACA AND EAST CENTRAL GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sumner Lake, or 8 miles northwest of Fort Sumner, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Yeso, Sumner Lake State Park and Sumner Lake. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 306 and 337. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Boaters should move to safe shelter now!
